title: Malware terminated in Ollydbg after a while - Why? [closed]
content:
I try to analyze a backdoor program with ollydbg. When I go through the assembly code by clicking the "Step Over"-Button, i stop sometimes to make a notice on a paper.
Later when i want to go trough the code again, suddenly the malware terminates itself.
I dont know why but it terminates.

Could it be a anti-debugging mechanism ? Because the behaviour its not normal. 
Someone has made same experiences and can help me?

edit: I have read something about a "Timing Checks" as anti-debuging techniques used by malware. So, with that technique the malware itself is able to find out if it is debugged.
Could it be something like that ?

comments.text: This is way too specific to the particular sample to give any answer. All we could give is ideas how to approach such situation.
Even after your edit, you do not give enough information to permit to answer. You should investigate deeper and give more insight of the program you are analyzing.
